STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
July 12, 2021
Ricky Sanville
Upper Peninsula Family Solutions
369 US 41 East
Negaunee, MI 49866
RE: License #: CB520304693
Investigation #: 2021C0116027
Upper Peninsula Family Solutions
Dear Mr. Sanville:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager, at (616) 552-3662.
611 W. OTTAWA  P.O. BOX 30664  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara  517-335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara Cote, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing

ALLEGATION:
Agency has history of issues regarding agency assessments/recommendations
regarding licensing evaluations and a history regarding impeding CPS
investigations.
INVESTIGATION:
The agency received a central intake notice on 03/08/2021 on Foster Home and
conducted a joint investigation with another DHHS investigator. Through the course
of the investigation, it was found that Foster Parent A did not disclose during the
completion of the 3130a, the initial home study or during the renewal evaluation his
substance abuse, use and treatment. Foster Parent B also did not disclose her
spouse’s substance abuse, use and treatment during the 3130a, initial home study
or renewal evaluation.
Foster Parent A had two Good Moral Character convictions, so an Administrative
Review Team (ART) had to be completed and approved for the home to be licensed.
The ART was approved based on the information the family provided during the
initial home study. Upon learning the new information that Foster Parent A and
Foster Parent B withheld during the initial home study, the ART was modified and
denied. The agency downplayed the concern of the family withholding information
regarding Foster Parent A’s substance abuse and use. The agency’s initial
recommendation was that the foster home license “continue with an acceptable
corrective action plan.” The agency’s recommendation was only changed due to
DCWL modifying the approved ART to a denial based on information that the family
withheld during the 3130a, initial licensure and renewal evaluation.
In the special evaluation report, the agency listed an alleged rule violation of Rule
9206 Foster home evaluation (b) Truthfully assist the agency in determining all of the
following: (vii) current substance abuse and current treatment yet failed to conclude
that a violation was established. By the family’s own admission, during the special
evaluation, they reported they withheld the current substance abuse and treatment
of Foster Parent A during the 3130a, the initial licensure and the renewal evaluation.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
 Upper Peninsula Family Solutions, Inc. Special Investigation Record
 Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System
(MiSACWIS) foster home documentation and special evaluation
documentation.
 Emails
 Another DHHS investigation report dated 04/06/2021
 Upper Peninsula Family Solutions, Inc. Special Evaluation Report dated
06/11/2021
3

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12325 License recommendation.
(1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
appropriate licensing action consistent with facts contained
in the foster home evaluation and any special evaluations.
ANALYSIS: The agency failed to make a recommendation that was
appropriate to the findings of the special evaluation. However,
based on a review of the agency’s license there is not a history
of this in the prior two years as alleged.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
INVESTIGATION:
In a review of the foster home documentation in MiSACWIS (Michigan Statewide
Automated Child Welfare Information System) the agency sent the CWL-259 ten
working days after learning of the special evaluation, instead of within five working
days. The special evaluation intake date was 03/08/2021 and the CWL-259 was
submitted to the Department of Child Welfare Licensing on 03/19/2021.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the
department's licensing authority within 5 working days in
the manner prescribed by the department.
ANALYSIS: The agency did not submit the CWL-259 within five working
days as required by policy.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR 2018C0102031 dated 06/07/2019
Corrective Action Plan approved 06/10/2019
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, the recommendation is to
continue the current license status.
July 6, 2021

Barbara Cote Date
